item.title: 特朗普称印度将停止购买俄罗斯供应，石油价格上涨
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普称印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪誓言停止购买俄罗斯桶装石油后，石油从五个月低点上涨，此举可能会挤压全球供应。【原文：Oil rose from a five-month low after US President Donald Trump said Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi had vowed to halt purchases of Russian barrels, a move that could squeeze global supply.】

item.title: 美国联邦通信委员会（FCC）采取行动禁止香港主要运营商使用美国网络
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会以国家安全为由，采取措施阻止香港最大的电话公司之一接入国内电信网络。【原文：The US Federal Communications Commission took steps to block one of Hong Kong’s largest phone companies from accessing domestic telecom networks, citing national security concerns.】

item.title: 欧洲央行穆勒警告中国出口限制可能加剧通胀
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马迪斯-穆勒表示，中国遏制稀土出口的措施如果波及全球经济，可能会重新引发欧元区的价格压力。【原文：Chinese measures to curb the export of rare earths could reignite price pressures in the euro zone if they ripple through the global economy, according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Madis Muller.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行肯特称放宽金融条件有助于平衡经济
item.description: 澳大利亚央行行长助理克里斯托弗-肯特（Christopher Kent）表示，澳大利亚央行认为紧缩的金融条件所带来的拖累正在缓解，这将有助于经济保持接近充分就业的水平，并使通胀率回归目标。【原文：Australia’s central bank sees the drag from tight financial conditions easing, helping the economy to stay near full employment with inflation returning to target, according to Assistant Governor Christopher Kent.】

item.title: 电动飞机制造商贝塔科技寻求 8.25 亿美元 IPO
item.description: 贝塔技术公司（Beta Technologies Inc.【原文：Beta Technologies Inc., a company making electricity-powered aircraft, is seeking to raise as much as $825 million in an initial public offering, proceeding despite the US government shutdown.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织称日本应避免增加债务，因为预算压力增大
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）的一位高级官员警告说，日本应避免为提振经济而举债，因为人们担心政治不稳定会导致支出增加，从而给长期债券收益率带来压力。【原文：Japan should avoid taking on more debt to boost its economy, a senior International Monetary Fund official warned, as concerns over higher spending triggered by political instability put pressure on long-term bond yields.】

item.title: 利润率紧缩，HPE 年度利润预测不及预期
item.description: 惠普企业公司（Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co.【原文：Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. gave an outlook for profit and cash flow for its upcoming fiscal year that fell short of analysts’ estimates, reflecting a margin crunch in the AI era.】

item.title: 黄金历史性反弹的背后原因
item.description:
今日大事件：黄金在不确定时期茁壮成长。但今天反弹的规模和速度暴露了人们对全球经济更深层次的担忧。【原文：

Today on the Big Take: Gold thrives in times of uncertainty. But the scale and the speed of today’s rally exposes deeper concerns about the global economy.

】

item.title: 交易员加码押注美联储年底降息半点
item.description: 交易商们纷纷下注，要求美联储在年底前至少进行一次大规模降息，押注美联储有可能采取比其他市场观察人士目前所预见的更为激进的政策。【原文：Traders are piling into wagers calling for at least one outsized Federal Reserve interest-rate cut by year—end, betting on the potential for more aggressive policy than other market watchers currently foresee.】

item.title: 淡水河谷投资者要求提高 30 亿美元债券回购报价
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在巴西矿商淡水河谷公司提出 30 亿美元的回购计划后，一批持有淡水河谷公司永续地方债券的投资者正在争取更好的条件。【原文：A group of investors holding Vale SA’s perpetual local bonds is pushing for better terms after the Brazilian miner proposed a $3 billion buyback, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行布洛克称目前利率政策 "略微收紧
item.description: 澳大利亚储备银行行长米歇尔-布洛克（Michele Bullock）将该国的货币政策描述为 "略微紧缩"，并补充说她指导利率的工作尚未结束。【原文：Reserve Bank of Australia Governor Michele Bullock characterized the country’s monetary policy as “marginally tight” and added that her job guiding interest rates isn’t finished.】

item.title: Candlestick 的伍德拉夫称美国联合航空公司股价飙升 150
item.description: Candlestick Capital Management 创始人杰克-伍德鲁夫（Jack Woodruff）表示，他预计未来两年美国联合航空公司的股价将翻一番以上。【原文：Candlestick Capital Management Founder Jack Woodruff said he expects shares of United Airlines to more than double in the next two years.】

item.title: 贝莱德计划推出浮动利率 ETF，正赶上美联储缩减货币政策
item.description: 就在美联储恢复降低借贷成本之际，贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc. is stepping further into the floating-rate debt arena, just as the Federal Reserve has resumed lowering borrowing costs.】

item.title: 数字货币专家称，加密货币生态系统在暴跌期间实际上 "运转 "良好
item.description: 麻省理工学院的数字货币专家认为，上周末的加密货币大跌无需恐慌。事实上，这证明了市场正在按照设计的方式运行：实验性的。【原文：Last weekend’s crypto selloff is no cause for panic, according to MIT’s digital currency expert. In fact, it’s proof that the market is operating as designed: experimentally.】

item.title: 官员称中国十年来一直在访问英国机密系统
item.description: 据两名前高级安全官员和其他熟悉此事的政府官员称，十多年来，中国国家行为者系统地成功入侵了英国政府的机密计算机系统。【原文：Chinese state actors systemically and successfully compromised classified UK government computer systems for more than a decade, according to two former senior security officials and other government officials familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 财政部票据发行量激增促使美联储缩减资产负债表
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周二表示，央行很可能在未来几个月内停止从资产负债表中减持国债，但他并未说明财政部在这一过程中所扮演的角色。【原文：Unstated when Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell indicated Tuesday that the central bank is likely to stop shedding Treasury securities from its balance sheet in the coming months was the role of the Treasury Department in setting the stage.】

item.title: 华尔街风险军备竞赛升级 5 倍杠杆 ETF
item.description: 就在最新一批超杠杆产品测试监管机构容忍度的外沿几天后，一项新的 ETF 提议又加倍努力了。【原文：Just days after the latest crop of hyper-leveraged products tested the outer edges of regulatory tolerance, a new ETF proposal is doubling down — literally.】

item.title: OpenAI 称甲骨文正在帮助处理芯片出口控制问题
item.description: OpenAI表示，甲骨文公司一直在帮助这家快速发展的初创公司扩大其在美国以外的数据中心建设，包括处理人工智能工作所需的芯片出口管制问题。【原文：OpenAI said that Oracle Corp. has been helping the fast-growing startup expand the build-out of its data centers outside the US, including by dealing with export controls on chips for artificial intelligence work.】

item.title: 核电初创公司 Deep Fission 首席执行官称已拥有 12.5 千兆瓦管道
item.description: 加州核能初创公司 Deep Fission Inc. 已与包括数据中心运营商在内的客户签署了 12.5 千兆瓦电力的非约束性协议。这相当于 12 个以上的传统反应堆。【原文：California nuclear energy startup Deep Fission Inc. has signed nonbinding deals with customers, including data center operators, for 12.5 gigawatts of power. That’s the equivalent of more than 12 traditional reactors.】

item.title: 戴蒙的 "蟑螂倒刺 "公司与私人信贷之间的不稳定休战破裂了
item.description: 在华尔街，每个人都是友好的竞争对手，直到亏损开始。【原文：On Wall Street, everyone’s a friendly rival until the losses start.】

item.title: 华尔街在美联储结束投资组合缩减的时机上扬
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）发出这一进程可能在未来几个月内结束的信号后，更多的华尔街策略师现在希望美联储能比此前预期的更早停止缩减其庞大的证券投资组合。【原文：More Wall Street strategists are now looking for the Federal Reserve to stop shrinking its massive portfolio of securities sooner than previously expected after Chair Jerome Powell signaled the process could end in coming months.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯计划对麦加进行大规模扩建，挖掘朝圣者的 "淘金热
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯计划在麦加大清真寺旁新建一个大规模的开发项目，以实现圣城的现代化，并满足每年数百万朝圣者的需求。【原文：Saudi Arabia plans to build a massive new development next to the Grand Mosque in Mecca as the kingdom seeks to modernize the holy city and accommodate millions more pilgrims each year.】

item.title: 英国顶级能源供应商警告电网升级将导致账单激增
item.description: 英国最大的几家能源供应商的高管警告说，政府推动的电网投资可能会在未来几年推高消费者的账单。【原文：The executives of some of Britain’s biggest energy suppliers are warning the government’s push to invest in the power grid could drive up consumer bills in the coming years.】

item.title: 美联储《米色报告》显示美国经济活动变化不大
item.description: 美联储表示，最近几周美国经济活动变化不大，就业水平基本保持稳定。【原文：US economic activity was little changed in recent weeks and employment levels held largely stable, the Federal Reserve said.】

item.title: 依视路收购眼科人工智能和数据管理公司 RetinAI
item.description: 依视路公司（EssilorLuxottica SA）在一份声明中称，该公司收购了一家专门从事人工智能和眼科数据管理的公司RetinAI。【原文：EssilorLuxottica SA said it bought RetinAI, a company specializing in artificial intelligence and data management in eyecare, according to a statement.】

item.title: 华尔街借势 IPO，股权咨询收入攀升
item.description: 华尔街最大的银行正在利用股票承销上升的优势，因为股市的强劲反弹重新点燃了首次公开募股市场，推动了咨询收入两位数百分比的增长。【原文：Wall Street’s biggest banks are taking advantage of rising stock underwriting after a powerful equity rally reignited the IPO market, fueling double-digit percentage gains in advisory revenue.】

item.title: 尽管第三季度是有史以来最繁忙的月份，但 9 月份洛杉矶港口进口量再次下降
item.description: 9 月份，美国最繁忙海港的进口流量连续第二个月下降，尽管进口总量在第三季度创下了历史新高，因为美国企业仍在应对动荡的美国贸易政策。【原文：The flow of imports at America’s busiest seaport dropped for a second month in September even as the total volume hit a record high in the third quarter, as US businesses continue to navigate volatile US trade policy.】

item.title: 华尔街银行因股价上涨而获得 150 亿美元交易收益
item.description: 华尔街上半年的辉煌交易是建立在处理关税引发的市场混乱的基础上的。第三季度显示，最大的银行也能抓住股市稳步走高的机会。【原文：Wall Street’s banner first half in trading was based on handling tariff-induced market chaos. The third quarter showed the biggest banks can also seize on the stock market’s steady march higher.】

item.title: 美国的数据灾难真的、真的、真的来了
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 防务公司 CSG 为 30 亿欧元阿姆斯特丹首次公开募股寻找投资者，最快一月上市
item.description: 装甲车辆和弹药制造商捷克斯洛伐克集团公司（Czechoslovak Group AS）正在与一批精选的潜在投资者进行初步谈判，考虑在 2026 年初上市，这可能是欧洲新年首次大规模的首次公开募股。【原文：Armored vehicle and munitions maker Czechoslovak Group AS is in preliminary talks with a select group of prospective investors as it considers going public in early 2026, in what could be Europe’s first sizable initial public offering of the new year.】
